posts.caption: googleonlinesecurity.blogspot.com
posts.description: I like the idea of more websites becoming secure.But, what about websites that don't have login forms or any other user input? I believe users on these kind of websites would not benefit from HTTPS in any way, or am I wrong?

posts.message:
Gulp, Grunt or npm: a JavaScript build system showdown.
In my personal experience, I have been using Grunt for a few months. It really fits everything I need.
I've encountered the "delay" the author is talking about in a project when it grew to become massive (tens of JavaScript/SCSS files, lots of images and SVGs, spriting ... etc)
The author highlighted some interesting points about Gulp I didn't know before.
